author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court on Tuesday admitted a petition moved by DMK leader M. Karunanidhi’s elder daughter S. Selvi seeking to discharge her from a cheating case pending before a Judicial Magistrate in Poonamallee.

The issue pertains to a complaint registered by V. Nedumaran alleging that Ms.Selvi and her son-in-law V.M. Jyothimani cheated him in connection with a purchase of a 2.94-acre property located in Chengalpattu, Kancheepuram district.

According to the complaint, the petitioner and her son-in-law entered into an agreement for sale with the complainant on July 5, 2007 for a total consideration of Rs. 5.14 crore. The complainant alleged that the duo received an advance amount of Rs. 3.5 crore but later failed to sell the property or return the advance.

Mr. Nedumaran also alleged that the petitioner along with others physically assaulted him and issued death threats for demanding to return the advance paid.

Subsequently, he moved the High Court to expedite the trial. The High Court directed the trial to be completed within six months.

Meanwhile, Ms.Selvi approached the Judicial Magistrate to discharge her from the case.

Since the magistrate dismissed her plea, she moved the High Court.
title: HC admits discharge plea moved by Karunanidhi’s daughter
